info.name: Election Violence Tracker API Documentation
info.description: The election violence tracker is an open source reporting tool that enables citizens to document and report violent incedents during Nigeria's election.

item.name: Update the specified resource in storage.

variable.description: The ID of the violence report.

item.name: Remove the specified resource from storage.

variable.description: The ID of the violence report.

request.description: This endpoint returns an array of objects containing all the states identified by it's `ng_states.data_id`

variable.description: mixed required the `data_id` or `name` of the state.

request.description: This endpoint returns a single state identified by it's `ng_states.data_id`

item.name: Fetch local government areas for a specified state

variable.description: mixed required the `data_id` or `name` of the local government you want to fetch LGAs for.

request.description: This endpoint returns an array of objects containing all the local government areas for a specific state identified by it's `ng_states.data_id`

item.name: Fetch wards for a specified local government area

variable.description: mixed required the `data_id` or `name` of the local government you want to fetch wards for.

request.description: This endpoint returns an array of objects containing all the wards for a specific local government identified by it's `ng_local_government_areas.data_id`

item.name: Fetch polling units for a specified ward

variable.description: mixed required the `data_id` or `name` of the ward you want to fetch polling units for.

request.description: This endpoint returns an array of objects containing all the polling units for a specific ward identified by it's `ng_wards.data_id`
This endpoint returns an array of objects containing all violence report types in storage.

It returns data for a specified location. Your search term will be searched against the name fied of the following objects `ng_states`, `ng_local_governments`, `ng_wards`, `ng_polling_units`. Data will be returned if `violence_reports` are found for a location that matches your search term
Returns violence reports from storage ordered by `created_at` `desc`. By default this endpoint returns 100 reports. You can increase this by adding a (int)`limit` query parameter

formdata.value: Repudiandae ratione est exercitationem labore et qui.
formdata.description: The `description` property is required if no file is attached

request.description: This endpoint creates a new violence report with the inputs passed and returns an object of the newly created  violence report.

variable.description: The ID of the violence report.

request.description: This endpoint returns a single report identified by `violence_reports.id`
